name: Chunky Garlic Bread
author: Helen Iorga
summary: First, don't let the times scare you away, you'll see it's not so hard. This is a recipe that I adapted from other garlic bread recipes; I wanted to try making my own garlic bread after realizing how bad the store-bought versions were.
ingredients: 1 large head garlic, or to taste
3 slices bread, or more as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C)
Bake garlic in the preheated oven until dark brown and softened, about 30 minutes
Remove garlic from the foil and let cool, about 7 minutes
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet
Peel garlic into a bowl; mash with butter to form a chunky paste
Spread garlic butter over the bread slices; top with tomato and Parmesan cheese
Bake in the preheated oven until the bread has absorbed the garlic butter, about 5 minutes
